## Overview

You typically derive a symmetric key from an instance of a shared secret ([doc://com.apple.CryptoKit/documentation/CryptoKit/SharedSecret]) that you obtain through key agreement. You use a symmetric key to compute a message authentication code like [doc://com.apple.CryptoKit/documentation/CryptoKit/HMAC], or to open and close a sealed box ([doc://com.apple.CryptoKit/documentation/CryptoKit/ChaChaPoly/SealedBox] or [doc://com.apple.CryptoKit/documentation/CryptoKit/AES/GCM/SealedBox]) using a cipher like [doc://com.apple.CryptoKit/documentation/CryptoKit/ChaChaPoly] or [doc://com.apple.CryptoKit/documentation/CryptoKit/AES].

# SymmetricKey

**Structure**

A symmetric cryptographic key.

## Declaration

```swift
struct SymmetricKey
```

## Overview

You typically derive a symmetric key from an instance of a shared secret ([doc://com.apple.CryptoKit/documentation/CryptoKit/SharedSecret]) that you obtain through key agreement. You use a symmetric key to compute a message authentication code like [doc://com.apple.CryptoKit/documentation/CryptoKit/HMAC], or to open and close a sealed box ([doc://com.apple.CryptoKit/documentation/CryptoKit/ChaChaPoly/SealedBox] or [doc://com.apple.CryptoKit/documentation/CryptoKit/AES/GCM/SealedBox]) using a cipher like [doc://com.apple.CryptoKit/documentation/CryptoKit/ChaChaPoly] or [doc://com.apple.CryptoKit/documentation/CryptoKit/AES].

## Creating a key

- **init(data:)**: Creates a key from the given data.
- **init(size:)**: Generates a new random key of the given size.

## Getting the key length

- **bitCount**: The number of bits in the key.

## Message authentication codes

- **HMAC**: A hash-based message authentication algorithm.
- **SymmetricKeySize**: The sizes that a symmetric cryptographic key can take.

## Conforms To

- ContiguousBytes
- Copyable
- Equatable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
